tasks.title: Project Setup and Configuration
tasks.description: Initialize monorepo structure with TypeScript and development tooling
tasks.details: Setup npm workspaces monorepo with packages/core, packages/cli, packages/shared. Configure TypeScript with strict mode, ESLint, Prettier, and git hooks.
tasks.testStrategy: Verify all packages build correctly, linting passes, and packages can reference each other

tasks.title: Implement Core Type System and Result Pattern
tasks.description: Create fundamental types and Result<T,E> pattern for error handling throughout the application
tasks.details: Implement Result<T,E> pattern in packages/core/src/types/result.ts with Ok() and Err() constructors. Create branded types for schema validation. Add core interfaces for SchemaNode, GenerationConfig, and ValidationResult.
tasks.testStrategy: Unit tests for Result pattern operations, type safety validation, and edge cases like nested Results. Test type guards and branded types.

tasks.title: Build Schema Parser with JSON Schema Support
tasks.description: Create schema parsing system that converts JSON Schema to internal representation
tasks.details: Implement SchemaParser class in packages/core/src/parser/schema-parser.ts. Parse JSON Schema into internal SchemaNode tree structure. Support basic types, arrays, nested objects (depth ≤ 2), enums, and constraints. Handle string formats. Return Result<SchemaNode, ParseError> for all operations.
tasks.testStrategy: Test with all example schemas in docs/examples/. Verify parsing of supported features and proper error handling for unsupported features like nested objects.

subtasks.title: Handle unsupported features
checklist: Return clear error messages with workarounds

tasks.title: Create Format Registry System
tasks.description: Implement extensible format registry for string formats like uuid, email, date
tasks.details: Build FormatRegistry class in packages/core/src/registry/format-registry.ts using Registry pattern. Register built-in formats: uuid, email, date, date-time. Allow custom format registration.
tasks.testStrategy: Test each built-in format generates valid data. Test custom format registration and invocation. Verify format constraints are respected.

tasks.title: Implement Core Data Generators
tasks.description: Build generator classes for primitive types with constraint support
tasks.details: Create abstract DataGenerator class and concrete implementations for all primitive types. Each generator implements generate(config: GenerationConfig): Result<any, GenerationError>. Use Faker.js as base but ensure constraint compliance.
tasks.testStrategy: Property-based testing with fast-check to verify all generated values meet constraints. Test edge cases like min=max, empty enums, and boundary values.

tasks.title: Build Array and Object Generators
tasks.description: Implement array generation supporting primitives and nested objects (depth ≤ 2), plus object generation
tasks.details: Create ArrayGenerator and ObjectGenerator classes. Support arrays of primitives and nested objects (depth ≤ 2). Respect minItems/maxItems constraints. Handle required fields correctly.
tasks.testStrategy: Test array length constraints, mixed primitive arrays, and nested object arrays (depth ≤ 2). Verify performance with large arrays (1000+ items). Test required vs optional fields.

tasks.title: Create Compliance Validator with AJV
tasks.description: Implement validation system to ensure 100% schema compliance
tasks.details: Build ComplianceValidator class using AJV for JSON Schema validation. Configure AJV with ajv-formats. Implement batch validation. Return detailed validation errors. Ensure strict mode.
tasks.testStrategy: Validate generated data against all example schemas. Test with intentionally invalid data. Performance test with 1000+ records.

tasks.title: Implement Generation Pipeline
tasks.description: Create main generation pipeline orchestrating parsing, generation, and validation
tasks.details: Build FoundryGenerator class orchestrating the pipeline: Parse → Plan → Generate → Validate. Deterministic generation via per-context PRNG (no global faker.seed). Enforce 100% compliance gate for supported features (otherwise fail with clear error). Collect per-stage metrics (parse/generate/validate): durations, AJV cache hit rate, formats used. Handle batch generation efficiently and expose a reproducible seed in outputs. This is the central pipeline that orchestrates the entire system and must be completed before documentation tasks.
tasks.testStrategy: Integration tests with all example schemas. Property-based tests asserting determinism: same seed → bit-identical outputs, prefix stability. Performance benchmarks: 1000 rows < 200ms, 10000 rows < 2s. Compliance invariant: score === 100 or explicit unsupported-feature error.

subtasks.title: Design Pipeline Orchestrator with Error Propagation
subtasks.description: Create FoundryGenerator class with Parse → Plan → Generate → Validate orchestration and comprehensive error handling
subtasks.details: Implement FoundryGenerator class in packages/core/src/generator/foundry-generator.ts with methods: parseSchema(), planGeneration(), generateData(), validateOutput(). Each stage returns Result<T,E> with proper error propagation. Define PipelineStage enum and PipelineMetrics interface. Implement stage-by-stage execution with early termination on errors. Include error context preservation across stages and detailed error messages referencing which stage failed.

subtasks.title: Implement Seed-Based Deterministic Generation
subtasks.description: Create per-context PRNG system ensuring deterministic generation without global faker.seed mutation
subtasks.details: Implement SeedManager class managing per-generation-context PRNGs. Create GenerationContext interface with isolated faker instance per generation call. Ensure same seed produces bit-identical outputs across runs. Implement seed derivation for batch generation (base_seed + row_index). Add seed validation and normalization. Expose used seed in generation results for reproducibility. Never mutate global faker.seed - each context gets its own faker instance.

subtasks.title: Add Performance Monitoring and Metrics Collection
subtasks.description: Implement comprehensive metrics collection for pipeline stages and performance optimization
subtasks.details: Create PipelineMetrics interface tracking per-stage durations, AJV cache hit rates, formats used, and memory usage. Implement MetricsCollector class with startStage()/endStage() methods. Add performance targets validation: 1000 rows < 200ms, 10000 rows < 2s. Implement batch generation optimization to minimize parser/validator overhead. Add memory usage tracking and cleanup. Include metrics in generation results for debugging and optimization.

subtasks.title: Create Integration Tests for Complete Pipeline
subtasks.description: Build comprehensive integration tests validating end-to-end pipeline functionality across all components
subtasks.details: Create integration tests in packages/core/src/generator/__tests__/foundry-generator.integration.test.ts testing all example schemas from docs/examples/. Implement property-based tests asserting determinism: same seed produces identical outputs, prefix stability for batch generation. Add performance benchmarks meeting targets. Test compliance invariant: 100% valid outputs or explicit unsupported-feature errors. Include error propagation tests and edge cases like empty schemas, invalid inputs, and resource constraints.

tasks.title: Build CLI Commands with Commander.js
tasks.description: Implement CLI interface with generate command and all required options
tasks.details: Create CLI structure using Commander.js. Implement generate command with options: --schema, --rows, --seed, --output. Add help and version commands. Handle file I/O operations.
tasks.testStrategy: CLI integration tests for all command variations. Test file input/output, error handling, and help text. Performance validation with CLI overhead.

tasks.title: Error Handling and User Experience
tasks.description: Implement comprehensive error system with clear user-facing messages
tasks.details: Enhance error reporting throughout the system. For unsupported features, provide clear explanations and workarounds. Include suggestions for future feature support.
tasks.testStrategy: Test error messages for all unsupported features. Verify helpful error context and workaround suggestions.

tasks.title: Complete Test Suite and Performance Validation
tasks.description: Ensure comprehensive testing and performance targets are met
tasks.details: Finalize all tests with 80%+ coverage. Validate performance benchmarks. Create compliance test suite validating 1000+ samples per schema type.
tasks.testStrategy: Achieve 80% test coverage minimum. All example schemas must generate valid data. Performance targets: 1000 rows < 200ms, 10000 rows < 2s.

tasks.title: Documentation and Examples
tasks.description: Create comprehensive documentation and example schemas
tasks.details: Write README with quickstart guide. Create example schemas for different use cases. Document API and CLI usage.
tasks.testStrategy: All examples must work with the CLI. Documentation code samples must be tested.

tasks.title: Launch Preparation
tasks.description: Prepare for npm publication and public launch
tasks.details: Setup GitHub repository, publish to npm, create demo materials, prepare launch communications.
tasks.testStrategy: Test npm installation globally and locally. Verify all links and demos work.

tasks.title: Enable pattern support in JSONSchemaParser
tasks.description: Propagate string `pattern` from JSON Schema into parsed StringSchema (instead of rejecting), aligned with StringGenerator capabilities.
tasks.details: Update packages/core/src/parser/json-schema-parser.ts to accept and pass through the `pattern` keyword for string schemas. Remove the current early rejection of `pattern`, validate regex only for syntactic correctness (try new RegExp), and store the original pattern string on the parsed schema. Ensure this remains draft-agnostic (Draft-07, 2019-09, 2020-12). Keep error messaging helpful for invalid regex. Add ReDoS guards: limit pattern length/complexity and provide a clear ParseError with suggestion; document generation fallbacks for complex patterns.
tasks.testStrategy: Add unit tests in packages/core/src/parser/__tests__/ to verify that: (1) valid pattern strings are preserved on parsed StringSchema; (2) invalid/too-complex regex patterns produce a clear ParseError with suggestion; (3) end-to-end: StringGenerator generates values matching the pattern when present, with safe fallbacks when patterns are complex. Add an integration test in test/__tests__/integration/generator-compliance/ to confirm AJV accepts generated values under schemas with pattern.

subtasks.title: Parser tests for pattern
checklist: Valid pattern passes and is preserved
Invalid pattern yields ParseError with suggestion

subtasks.title: Docs and limitations update
checklist: Mention supported regex scope and caveats

tasks.title: Introduce Per-Context PRNG (remove global faker.seed)
tasks.description: Replace global Faker seeding with a per-context deterministic PRNG exposed via GeneratorContext to ensure isolation and reproducibility.
tasks.details: ACCEPTANCE: (1) No calls to faker.seed in repo; (2) Same seed + same schema → bit-identical outputs across runs and in parallel; (3) Overhead <5% vs baseline on micro-benchmarks (p95). IMPLEMENTATION: Add RNG interface (next(), int(min,max), float(min,max)) to GeneratorContext; implement seeded PRNG (mulberry32/xorshift) with pure state; refactor generators to use context RNG for selection/shuffle; document determinism guarantees.
tasks.testStrategy: Determinism tests (same seed → identical outputs); concurrency tests (N workers); integration in full pipeline with prefix-stability; micro-benchmarks to verify overhead <5%.

tasks.title: Stable Cache Key for AJV Compiled Validators
tasks.description: Use a stable stringify or hashing strategy for schema cache keys to maximize cache hits and avoid recompilation due to key order.
tasks.details: ACCEPTANCE: schemas with different key orders share the same cache entry; improved cache hit rate recorded. IMPLEMENTATION: canonical stringify (sorted keys) or fast hash; retain WeakMap for identity; guard heavy canonicalization. METRICS: before/after hit-rate and compile counts.
tasks.testStrategy: Unit tests for key equality across orderings; measure hit/miss deltas in validator metrics; micro-bench compile vs cached validate.

tasks.title: Support Bounded Nested Object Parsing
tasks.description: Allow nested objects in JSONSchemaParser up to a configurable depth; beyond the limit, produce a clear ParseError with suggestions.
tasks.details: ACCEPTANCE: nested objects parsed up to default depth=2; deeper structures fail fast with guidance. IMPLEMENTATION: recursive descent with depth counter; reuse existing type guards; keep MVP constraints documented. TESTS: AJV × generator end-to-end for nested objects within bounds.
tasks.testStrategy: Unit tests for depth boundary; integration tests ensuring generated nested objects validate; error-path tests with suggestion messages for over-depth schemas.

tasks.title: Format Registry Init: Exactly-Once & Tests
tasks.description: Guarantee that built-in formats initialize exactly once even with deep imports; add tests for idempotence and direct-registry import.
tasks.details: ACCEPTANCE: lazy init runs once; re-imports or deep imports do not duplicate registration; no memory leaks. TESTS: import registry without core index; verify formats available and registered once.
tasks.testStrategy: Unit tests in registry __tests__ for lazy init idempotence and deep import behavior; integration test touching generators that use formats.

metadata.approach: Hybrid - Task Master structure with granular subtasks

Subtasks provide actionable 1-4 hour work items
Test strategy integrated in each main task (TDD approach)
Technical details preserved from Task Master
Added missing setup, documentation, and launch tasks

tasks.title: Configure CI/CD Pipeline for Testing
tasks.description: Phase 5 - Setup comprehensive CI/CD pipeline with multi-draft and multi-platform testing architecture v2.1
tasks.details:
**MATRIX TESTING CONFIGURATION:**
- Create .github/workflows/test.yml with testing v2.1 architecture
- Configure test matrix: draft-07 × 2019-09 × 2020-12 with SCHEMA_DRAFT environment variable
- Node.js versions: 18.x, 20.x, latest with proper npm cache configuration
- OS platforms: ubuntu-latest, macos-latest, windows-latest with platform-specific pool tolerances
- Pool configuration: 'threads' for Windows, 'forks' for other platforms

**ENVIRONMENT VARIABLES (Testing v2.1):**
- TEST_SEED=424242 for deterministic testing (NEVER Date.now())
- FC_NUM_RUNS: 100 (quick jobs), 1000 (full jobs), configurable per job type
- SCHEMA_DRAFT: draft-07|2019-09|2020-12 for multi-draft testing matrix
- DEBUG=false (CI), true (debug jobs) for logging control
- PERF_LOG=true for performance jobs with baseline comparison

**JOB TYPES ARCHITECTURE:**
- quick-tests: 5min timeout, FC_NUM_RUNS=100, core functionality validation
- full-tests: 30min timeout, FC_NUM_RUNS=1000, comprehensive matrix testing
- performance-tests: isolated job with baseline.json comparison and regression detection
- memory-tests: extended runs with leak detection and GC monitoring

**ARTIFACT MANAGEMENT & OPTIMIZATION:**
- Upload baseline.json for performance tracking and trend analysis
- Coverage reports with lcov format for external tools integration
- Test results with junit XML for GitHub annotations
- Performance reports with regression alerts (>20% degradation fails CI)
- Cache strategy: npm cache, compiled schemas, baseline artifacts
- Parallel job execution with proper dependency management
- Fail-fast: false for matrix jobs to collect all results
- Retry strategy: 0 retries (deterministic testing principle)

**STATUS REPORTING & QUALITY GATES:**
- GitHub status badges for README: test status, coverage, performance
- PR comments with performance regression alerts and artifact links
- All tests must pass with 100% compliance invariant
- Coverage threshold: 90% line coverage minimum
- Memory regression: >100MB increase fails CI
- ESLint: zero errors allowed with auto-fix in dedicated job
tasks.testStrategy: Validate CI/CD configuration with test matrix execution across all draft × node × OS combinations. Verify deterministic behavior with fixed TEST_SEED=424242. Test artifact generation and baseline comparison functionality. Validate performance regression detection with intentional slowdowns. Test coverage reporting integration and quality gates enforcement.

tasks.title: Implement Oracle Testing Pattern
tasks.description: Phase 2 - Use AJV as validation oracle for consistency testing, implementing the architecture defined in ADR docs/tests/format-registry-ajv-integration-decision.md with advanced caching and testing v2.1 compliance
tasks.details:
- Create test/patterns/oracle-testing.test.ts following ADR architecture and testing v2.1 standards
- Implement AJV integration via getAjv() singleton with WeakMap caching of compiled validators
- Implement 100% agreement invariant: expect(ourValidator(data)).toBe(ajvValidator(data))
- Zero tolerance policy: Both validators MUST agree on ALL validation results
- Integrate custom matchers: toMatchJsonSchema for AJV compliance verification
- Implement toHaveAgreement(expectedRate) matcher with division by zero protection
- Use stable comparison with sorted keys stringify for object consistency
- Test with deterministic seed 424242 (never Date.now() or random seeds)
- Complete failure logging: seed + schema + data + discrepancies for reproduction
- Multi-draft matrix testing: draft-07, 2019-09, 2020-12 using getSchemaArbitrary()
- Implement FormatRegistry-AJV adapter per ADR specification
- Test format validation consistency: FormatRegistry vs AJV formats
- Handle format policy v2.2: assertive formats (email, uuid) vs annotative formats
- Test cross-format validation with all supported formats per draft
- Oracle testing patterns: positive cases (valid data passes both), negative cases (invalid data fails both)
- Test boundary conditions where systems might disagree
- Property-based testing with fc.property() and invariant checking
- Performance comparison: oracle shouldn't be slower than 2x our validator
- Categorize discrepancies: format differences, draft differences, implementation bugs
- Zero tolerance approach: investigate and fix ALL disagreements with full context logging

tasks.title: Handle JSON Schema References and Circular Dependencies
tasks.description: Implement detection and handling of $ref, $recursiveRef, $dynamicRef with proper cycle detection algorithms. Create reference resolution engine and circular dependency breaking strategies.
tasks.details:
- Create packages/core/parser/reference-resolver.ts with comprehensive reference handling
- Implement ReferenceResolver class with support for:
  * $ref resolution with URI fragment handling (#/definitions/User)
  * $recursiveRef resolution for recursive schemas (draft 2019-09)
  * $dynamicRef/$dynamicAnchor resolution (draft 2020-12)
  * External reference loading with URI resolution
- Implement cycle detection using Set-based tracking of reference paths
- Create CircularDependencyDetector with algorithms:
  * Depth-first traversal with visited node tracking
  * Stack-based cycle detection for immediate loops
  * Global reference graph analysis for complex cycles
- Implement breaking strategies:
  * Lazy resolution with reference placeholders
  * Maximum depth limiting (default: 10 levels)
  * Reference cache with WeakMap for performance
- Add support for JSON Pointer resolution (RFC 6901)
- Handle base URI resolution and relative references
- Integrate with existing Schema union types
- Add comprehensive error handling with descriptive messages
- Create reference resolution context with scope tracking
tasks.testStrategy: Create comprehensive test suite with reference scenarios: simple $ref to definitions, nested references, circular self-references, mutual circular references, external file references (mocked), invalid reference handling. Test cycle detection with various loop patterns: direct self-reference, two-node cycles, complex multi-node cycles, deeply nested references. Validate reference resolution across all JSON Schema drafts with draft-specific features. Use property-based testing for reference path generation and resolution. tasks.title: Create Generator Compliance Integration Tests
tasks.description: Implement comprehensive integration tests that verify all generators produce 100% AJV-compliant data across all supported JSON Schema drafts.
tasks.details:
INTEGRATION TEST ARCHITECTURE:
- Create test/__tests__/integration/generator-compliance/ directory structure
- Implement end-to-end generator → AJV validation pipeline tests
- Test all generator types (string, number, integer, boolean, array, object, enum) against AJV oracle
- Cross-draft compliance testing: draft-07, 2019-09, 2020-12

COMPLIANCE VERIFICATION:
- Use getAjv() singleton with WeakMap caching for compiled validators
- Implement 100% compliance invariant: expect(compliance).toBe(100) never >95%
- Test constraint coherence: required ⊆ properties, enum/const respect bounds
- FormatRegistry-AJV adapter integration for format validation

SCENARIO COVERAGE:
- Normal generation scenarios with realistic constraints
- Edge cases: min/max bounds, empty arrays, boundary conditions
- Stress testing: maximum array lengths, complex nested structures
- Error conditions: contradictory constraints, invalid combinations

PERFORMANCE INTEGRATION:
- Percentile-based benchmarks: p95 < 200ms for 1000 records
- Memory monitoring during bulk generation and validation
- Cache effectiveness metrics for validator compilation

DRAFT-SPECIFIC TESTING:
- exclusiveMinimum boolean vs number semantics
- Format validation behavior differences across drafts
- Keyword support variations (const in draft-07 vs 2019-09+)
tasks.testStrategy: Use custom matchers (toMatchJsonSchema, toBeDistinct, toHaveCompliance) for validation. Implement deterministic testing with fixed seed 424242 for reproducible results. Test with business scenario arbitraries for realistic load patterns. Verify memory leak detection and cache performance. Apply percentile-based performance targets (p95 < 200ms). Test cross-draft compatibility with FormatRegistry-AJV adapter. Validate 100% compliance invariant across all generator types and constraint combinations.

tasks.title: Verify Per-Context PRNG Determinism (master:27)
tasks.description: Testing v2 - Validate determinism and parallel reproducibility of the per-context PRNG implemented in master task 27.
tasks.details: ACCEPTANCE: (1) Same seed + same schema → bit-identical outputs across runs; (2) Parallel executions (N workers) produce identical outputs; (3) Prefix-stability holds; (4) No calls to faker.seed exist in codebase. REPORT: record p95 overhead <5% in micro-benchmarks.
tasks.testStrategy: Property-based tests for determinism and prefix-stability at pipeline level; concurrency tests with worker threads/process pool; micro-benchmarks comparing PRNG vs baseline (report percentiles).

tasks.title: Measure AJV Cache Effectiveness (master:28)

tasks.details: ACCEPTANCE: (1) Semantically identical schemas (reordered keys) use the same compiled validator; (2) Cache hit rate improves vs baseline; (3) Compile count reduced under repeated validation workloads. REPORT: include hit/miss deltas and timing percentiles.
tasks.testStrategy: Create reordered-schema fixtures and validate equality of cache key behavior; run micro-bench compile vs cached validate; record metrics and assert thresholds; integrate with performance baseline/regression suite.

subtasks.description: Create the ErrorContext interface with all required fields for error localization
subtasks.details:
Define in packages/core/src/types/errors.ts:
interface ErrorContext {
  path?: string;           // JSON Pointer: '/properties/address'
  schemaPath?: string;     // Schema path: '#/properties/address'
  ref?: string;            // Reference URI
  value?: unknown;         // Problematic value (redacted in prod)
  valueExcerpt?: string;   // Safe excerpt of value
  limitationKey?: string;  // Links to limitation registry
  availableIn?: string;    // Version when feature available
}
<info added on 2025-09-05T21:50:10.145Z>
Path semantics clarification: path represents data instance path (JSON Pointer format from AJV instancePath like '/users/0/name'), schemaPath represents schema definition path (JSON Schema pointer like '#/properties/users/items/properties/name'). ValidationError should use path field for data location (AJV instancePath), while SchemaError and reference-resolver should use schemaPath field for schema locations. Tests required: verify ValidationError populates path with instancePath, verify SchemaError/reference-resolver populate schemaPath correctly.

tasks.title: Update Error Emission Points
tasks.description: Refactor all error throwing locations to use new constructor pattern with proper error codes and JSON Pointer paths
tasks.details:
Update packages/core/src/parser/reference-resolver.ts and other emission points:

BEFORE:
throw new SchemaError(message, pathOrRef, suggestion?)

AFTER:
throw new SchemaError({
  message,
  errorCode: ErrorCode.SPECIFIC_CODE,
  context: {
    path: pointer,      // JSON Pointer format
    schemaPath: pointer,
    ref: refUri
  }
})

Error code mappings:
- Circular reference → CIRCULAR_REFERENCE_DETECTED (E012)
- Max depth exceeded → INVALID_SCHEMA_STRUCTURE
- Invalid JSON Pointer → INVALID_SCHEMA_STRUCTURE  
- Missing external schema → SCHEMA_PARSE_FAILED

Search for all "throw new" statements and update accordingly.

  * Circular reference → CIRCULAR_REFERENCE_DETECTED
  * Max depth exceeded → INVALID_SCHEMA_STRUCTURE
  * Invalid JSON Pointer → INVALID_SCHEMA_STRUCTURE
  * Missing external schema → SCHEMA_PARSE_FAILED
- Include JSON Pointer path and schemaPath in context
<info added on 2025-09-05T21:54:10.285Z>
For the reference-resolver.ts error parameter corrections:
- Use schemaPath for JSON Schema pointer (not path)
- Use ref for URI reference
- Keep path field empty/undefined for SchemaError (reserved for data validation)
- Avoid duplicating pointer value across multiple fields

Updated pattern should be:
```
throw new SchemaError({
  message,
  errorCode: ErrorCode.SPECIFIC_CODE,
  context: {
    schemaPath: jsonPointer,  // JSON Schema location
    ref: uriReference        // External reference URI
    // path: undefined        // Reserved for data paths
  }
})
```

tasks.title: Utility: Exact Rational Arithmetic with Caps and Fallbacks
tasks.description: Implement rational helpers used by multipleOf, including bit/LCM caps and fallbacks.
tasks.details:
[Context]
Context need: 1/5
Must read:
- docs/feature-simplification/README.md#pipeline
- docs/feature-simplification/Features.md#multipleof-rational
Nice to read:
- docs/feature-simplification/Invariants.md#ajv-is-the-oracle
- docs/feature-simplification/Features.md#generator
---
Sections 8 (Numbers), 10 (Repair), 15 (Metrics)

Requirements:
- Internal Rat type: { p: bigint; q: bigint } reduced with gcd.
- Operations: reduce, lcm, multiply, compare, snapToMultiple(value, m), bitLen.
- Intersection of multipleOf m1 = p1/q1 and m2 = p2/q2 is lcm(p1,p2)/gcd(q1,q2) on reduced forms.
- Caps: if bitLen(p|q) > maxRatBits OR bitLen(lcm) > maxLcmBits OR q > qCap ⇒ fallback.
- Fallbacks: 'decimal' with decimalPrecision rounding aligned to AJV tolerance; 'float' as last resort.
- Diagnostics emitted by callers: RAT_LCM_BITS_CAPPED, RAT_DEN_CAPPED, RAT_FALLBACK_DECIMAL, RAT_FALLBACK_FLOAT.
- JSON-safe representation for logs via toJSONSafe: { num: string; den: string }.
tasks.testStrategy: Unit tests: reduce, lcm/gcd, intersection identities (1/2 ∧ 1/3 = 1; 2/3 ∧ 1/6 = 2/3; 3/10 ∧ 9/20 = 9/10). Caps pathways; rounding behavior vs AJV.

tasks.title: Schema Normalizer (all passes, notes, freeze)
tasks.description: Draft-aware canonicalization with guarded conditional rewrites and diagnostics.
tasks.details:
[Context]
Context need: 5/5
Must read:
- docs/feature-simplification/Invariants.md#evaluation-scope-and-unevaluated
- docs/feature-simplification/Features.md#conditionals
- docs/feature-simplification/Features.md#normalizer
Nice to read:
- docs/feature-simplification/Known-Limits.md#dynamic-refs
- docs/feature-simplification/error.md#diagnostics-catalog
---
[Normative context]
Scope: Produce a canonical, draft-aware schema without changing semantics. Preserve original schema for validation; never cross $id boundaries.

Invariants:
- Default: do not rewrite conditionals; only rewrite under 'safe' mode with guards.
- Preserve $dynamicRef, $dynamicAnchor, $recursiveRef; emit DYNAMIC_PRESENT; never attempt to resolve across documents.
- Rewrite definitions→$defs; id→$id; Draft‑04 tuple forms to 2020‑12 equivalents (prefixItems/items mapping).
- propertyNames rewrite only when strictly equivalent and no unevaluated* scope interactions.
- No mutation after normalization when debugFreeze (unless disableDeepFreeze).
- Validation is always performed against the original schema via AJV.

Algorithm (high‑level):
1) Draft unification (defs/id, tuples, OpenAPI nullable).
2) Local ref rewriting (#/definitions→#/$defs if present); never cross $id; keep anchors/dynamic anchors.
3) Boolean/trivial simplifications; normalize enum↔const (size‑1) for planning.
4) Conditionals: guarded double‑negation rewrite only when safe; cap generated NOT depth.
5) Dependencies/dependents: guarded alternatives (annotation‑safe anyOf) when applicable.
6) Object keywords: preserve/add rules for patternProperties, propertyNames, additionalProperties; strict equivalence required for any rewrite.
7) Pass‑through $dynamic* unchanged; note presence.

Diagnostics in scope:
- IF_REWRITE_DOUBLE_NOT, IF_REWRITE_SKIPPED_UNEVALUATED, IF_REWRITE_DISABLED_ANNOTATION_RISK,
 ANNOTATION_IN_SCOPE_IF_REWRITE_SKIPPED, PNAMES_COMPLEX, DEPENDENCY_GUARDED,
 DYNAMIC_PRESENT, DEFS_TARGET_MISSING, EXCLMIN_IGNORED_NO_MIN, EXCLMAX_IGNORED_NO_MAX,
 OAS_NULLABLE_KEEP_ANNOT, NOT_DEPTH_CAPPED.

Example:
- Input (Draft‑04): { "items":[S1,S2], "additionalItems":false } → Canonical: { "prefixItems":[S1,S2], "items":false }.
- Conditional under unevaluatedProperties:false → no rewrite; emit IF_REWRITE_SKIPPED_UNEVALUATED.

Known limits:
- External $ref not supported by the normalizer (no network); handle via AJV config and failFast policies.
---
Section 7 — Schema Normalizer
Passes:
1) Draft unification: definitions→$defs; id→$id; tuples to prefixItems/items; OpenAPI nullable handling.
2) References: keep local #..., rewrite #/definitions/...→#/$defs/... only if target exists; never cross $id; keep dynamic anchors.
3) Boolean/trivial: fold true/false entries; normalize enum↔const (size‑1) for planning only.
4) Conditionals: default no rewrite; safe double-negation only when no unevaluated* in scope or ancestors and no evaluation-affecting keywords nearby. Partial forms preserved. Cap nested NOT by guards.
5) Dependencies/dependents: provide guarded object typing; or annotation-safe anyOf alternative; never rewrite under unevaluated*.
6) Object keywords: preserve patternProperties/propertyNames/additionalProperties; rewrite propertyNames only when strictly equivalent (pattern or closed enum) and no unevaluated* influence.
7) Pass-through: $dynamicRef/$dynamicAnchor/$recursiveRef untouched; note DYNAMIC_PRESENT.
8) Dev safety: optional deep-freeze when debugFreeze && !disableDeepFreeze.
Artifacts:
- { schema, ptrMap, revPtrMap, notes[] }.
Notes catalog includes: IF_REWRITE_DOUBLE_NOT, IF_REWRITE_SKIPPED_UNEVALUATED, ANNOTATION_IN_SCOPE_IF_REWRITE_SKIPPED, IF_REWRITE_DISABLED_ANNOTATION_RISK, PNAMES_COMPLEX, DEPENDENCY_GUARDED, DYNAMIC_PRESENT, DEFS_TARGET_MISSING, EXCLMIN_IGNORED_NO_MIN, EXCLMAX_IGNORED_NO_MAX, OAS_NULLABLE_KEEP_ANNOT, NOT_DEPTH_CAPPED.
tasks.testStrategy: Golden tests for each pass; verify notes; ensure canonicalization does not change validation results against original schema.

tasks.title: Composition Engine (effective view)
tasks.description: Domain-aware allOf merge, bagged 'contains', must-cover for AP:false, overlaps, early UNSAT, caps.
tasks.details:
[Context]
Context need: 5/5
Must read:
- docs/feature-simplification/Invariants.md#ap-false-must-cover
- docs/feature-simplification/Invariants.md#contains-bag-semantics
- docs/feature-simplification/Invariants.md#enum-const-over-type
- docs/feature-simplification/Features.md#composition
Nice to read:
- docs/feature-simplification/error.md#diagnostics-catalog
- docs/feature-simplification/Features.md#arrays-and-tuples
---
[Normative context]
Scope: Build an effective view for generation without mutating the canonical schema; AJV validates against the original schema.

Invariants:
- additionalProperties:false across allOf ⇒ generate only keys covered by all recognizers (properties + anchored patternProperties).
- contains ⇒ represent as a bag of needs; in allOf concatenate needs; early‑UNSAT if Σ min_i > maxItems, or any single need has min > maxItems, or provably disjoint needs include a max=0 alongside another with min>0.
- enum/const outrank type; empty enum intersection ⇒ UNSAT.
- multipleOf intersection uses exact rational math; apply caps and fallbacks with RAT_* diagnostics.
- Do not collapse items/additionalProperties too aggressively; take intersections where schemas are provided.

Algorithm (high‑level):
1) Types: set intersection; empty ⇒ UNSAT. Enums/consts: set intersection; conflicting const ⇒ UNSAT.
2) Numbers: intersect bounds; multipleOf via reduced rationals L = lcm(p1,p2)/gcd(q1,q2); apply caps & fallbacks; record diagnostics.
3) Objects: compute must‑cover keyset; merge properties; conjunct patternProperties; record overlaps (when enabled).
4) Arrays: tuple semantics; items:false induces implicit max length; merge contains bag; run early‑UNSAT checks.
5) Record diag: overlaps, caps, unsatHints, chosenBranch score when applicable.

Branch selection:
- Deterministic, discriminant‑first scoring. If branch count > skipTrialsIfBranchesGt or skipTrials=true ⇒ score‑only selection: stable sort by score, then stable index; final tie‑break via RNG seeded by (globalSeed ⊕ hash(schemaPath)); no trials attempted.

Diagnostics in scope:
- AP_FALSE_INTERSECTION_APPROX, CONTAINS_BAG_COMBINED, CONTAINS_UNSAT_BY_SUM,
 COMPLEXITY_CAP_ONEOF|ANYOF|PATTERNS|ENUM|CONTAINS|SCHEMA_SIZE,
 UNSAT_PATTERN_PNAMES, UNSAT_DEPENDENT_REQUIRED_AP_FALSE, RAT_.

Example:
- allOf where one conjunct sets items:false with 2 prefixItems and another sets minItems:3 ⇒ early UNSAT.
- allOf of two multipleOf: 2/3 and 3/10 ⇒ intersection multipleOf = 1/5; if caps exceeded, fallback to decimal and emit RAT_FALLBACK_DECIMAL.

Known limits:
- Non‑anchored regex patterns may require conservative approximations; emit AP_FALSE_INTERSECTION_APPROX.
---
Section 8 — Composition
- Type: intersect sets; empty ⇒ UNSAT.
- Enum/Const: intersect enum; conflicting const ⇒ UNSAT; enums outrank type in generation.
- Numbers: bounds intersection; multipleOf via exact rationals (Task 2) with caps → fallbacks; emit RAT_ diagnostics.
- Objects: AP:false semantics across allOf via must‑cover intersection of recognizers (properties + anchored patternProperties). Approximate non-anchored patterns conservatively; emit AP_FALSE_INTERSECTION_APPROX. Merge properties; union required; conjunct patternProperties; record overlaps when enabled.
- Arrays: tuple semantics with items:false inducing implicit max length; items merged via allOf.
- 'contains' bag semantics: represent each need independently (schema, min, max). In allOf, concatenate; optional subsumption. Early UNSAT checks:
 • Σ min_i > maxItems ⇒ CONTAINS_UNSAT_BY_SUM
 • any need with min > maxItems ⇒ UNSAT
 • provably disjoint needs with conflicting min/max (e.g., one has max=0 alongside another min>0) ⇒ UNSAT
 • single-need rule: if a need has maxContains === 0 and minContains > 0 ⇒ UNSAT (explicit).
 Emit CONTAINS_BAG_COMBINED when bags merge.
- Early UNSAT extensions: UNSAT_PATTERN_PNAMES (closed propertyNames vs patterns); UNSAT_DEPENDENT_REQUIRED_AP_FALSE (dependents impossible under must-cover).
- Complexity caps & degradation: COMPLEXITY_CAP_* diagnostics; switch to score‑only (deterministic as above), skip overlap analysis, reduce Top‑K.
- Diagnostics surface: diag = { unsatHints, chosenBranch, overlap, overlaps.patterns, scoreDetails, budget, metrics, caps }.
tasks.testStrategy: Unit: targeted merges (numbers, objects AP:false, arrays, contains bag). Early UNSAT scenarios including single-need (maxContains===0 && minContains>0). Approximation diagnostics. Integration: AJV parity on composed effective view vs original validation.

tasks.title: Branch Selection & Trials Policy
tasks.description: Discriminant-first scoring, Top-K trials, skip-trials threshold, oneOf exclusivity refinement.
tasks.details:
[Context]
Context need: 4/5
Must read:
- docs/feature-simplification/Features.md#branch-selection
- docs/feature-simplification/Invariants.md#determinism-and-seeding
Nice to read:
- docs/feature-simplification/error.md#trials_skipped_large_oneof
- docs/feature-simplification/Features.md#composition
---
[Normative context]
Scope: Deterministically pick branches for anyOf/oneOf using discriminant‑first scoring and bounded trials. Enforce oneOf exclusivity post‑generation via validation and refinement; no mutation of canonical schema.

Invariants:
- Scoring prioritizes clear discriminants: const/enum tags, required+const, anchored disjoint patterns, disjoint types.
- Trials are bounded (Top‑K only). Large fan‑out ⇒ score‑only selection; emit TRIALS_SKIPPED_LARGE_ONEOF.
- oneOf exclusivity enforced after instance generation: refine discriminants or apply bounded tweaks; must end with exactly one passing branch.
- Ties: stable index, then RNG(seed ⊕ pathHash).

Algorithm (high‑level):
1) Compute score for each branch.
2) Select Top‑K; for each, attempt up to perBranch generation+validation attempts.
3) If no trials (skipped/threshold), choose highest score deterministically.
4) For oneOf, validate instance against all branches; if >1 pass, attempt non‑destructive refinement (fix discriminant), then bounded tweaks (numeric nudge, inject char).

Diagnostics:
- TRIALS_SKIPPED_LARGE_ONEOF, diag.budget (tried/limit/skipped), diag.overlap (passing branches).

Example:
- oneOf tagged by kind const values ⇒ scoring picks branch with matching const; exclusivity passes with no tweaks.

Known limits:
- Heuristics may over‑ or under‑estimate discriminants when patterns overlap heavily; rely on AJV validation and refinement step.
---
Section 8 — Branch Selection
- Scoring weights: +1000 (disjoint const/enum on same key), +200 (required+const/enum), +50 (anchored disjoint patterns), +10 (disjoint type), negatives for overlaps. Tie-breaker: stable index then RNG(seed ⊕ pathHash).
- Trials: compute scores for all branches, try Top‑K; if branches > skipTrialsIfBranchesGt or skipTrials: score-only; record diag.budget.
- oneOf exclusivity: after generation, validate against all branches; if >1 pass, do non-destructive refinement (fix discriminant) then bounded tweaks (numeric nudge, inject char). Record diag.overlap.
tasks.testStrategy: Unit: scoring determinism; Top‑K selection; skip-trials path. Integration: exclusive final instances for oneOf with overlap introduced.

tasks.title: Conditionals: if-aware-lite Generation
tasks.description: Bias generation around 'if/then/else' when not rewriting; minimal then-satisfaction.
tasks.details:
[Context]
Context need: 5/5
Must read:
- docs/feature-simplification/Features.md#conditionals
- docs/feature-simplification/Invariants.md#conditionals-no-rewrite-by-default
Nice to read:
- docs/feature-simplification/error.md#if_aware_hint_applied
- docs/feature-simplification/error.md#if_aware_hint_skipped_insufficient_info
---
[Normative context]
Scope: When rewriteConditionals is not used, guide generation to satisfy if/then/else with minimal effort and no global backtracking.

Invariants:
- Do not alter schema semantics; no rewrite here.
- If partial instance likely satisfies if, satisfy minimally then according to minThenSatisfaction (discriminants‑only | required‑only | required+bounds).
- If if is likely unsatisfied, avoid activating then (omit discriminants that would satisfy if).
- Rely on Repair engine to complete any remaining constraints.

Algorithm (high‑level):
1) Evaluate if predicates on the partial object under construction (fast checks: const/enum on tag keys, required presence, simple bounds).
2) If satisfied ⇒ materialize minimal then pieces.
3) Else ⇒ avoid keys that would flip if to true.
4) Emit IF_AWARE_HINT_APPLIED or IF_AWARE_HINT_SKIPPED_INSUFFICIENT_INFO accordingly.

Diagnostics:
- IF_AWARE_HINT_APPLIED, IF_AWARE_HINT_SKIPPED_INSUFFICIENT_INFO.

Example:
- if: {properties:{type:{const:'foo'}}} then:{required:['x']} ⇒ generator sets x only when it emits type:'foo'.

Known limits:
- Nested conditionals with intertwined oneOf may still require repair passes; this strategy only reduces the number of validations/repairs.
---
Section 9 — Conditionals strategy
- Pre-evaluate 'if' on partial instance; if likely satisfied, satisfy minimal subset of 'then' per option minThenSatisfaction ('discriminants-only' | 'required-only' | 'required+bounds').
- If 'if' appears unsatisfied, avoid activating 'then' (omit discriminant where possible).
- No global backtracking; rely on Repair for completion.
- Diagnostics: IF_AWARE_HINT_APPLIED, IF_AWARE_HINT_SKIPPED_INSUFFICIENT_INFO.
tasks.testStrategy: Unit: cases with if-only, then-only, if+then+else nested; verify reduced validationsPerRow vs repair-only. Integration: AJV parity.

tasks.title: Generator (strings, numbers, arrays, objects, formats)
tasks.description: Implement deterministic generators that honor effective constraints and must-cover.
tasks.details:
[Context]
Context need: 5/5
Must read:
- docs/feature-simplification/Invariants.md#effective-view-consumption
- docs/feature-simplification/Features.md#generator
- docs/feature-simplification/Invariants.md#ap-false-must-cover
- docs/feature-simplification/Invariants.md#contains-bag-semantics
Nice to read:
- docs/feature-simplification/Known-Limits.md#pattern-approximations
- docs/feature-simplification/Features.md#formats
---
[Normative context]
Scope: Generate values that satisfy the effective view from the Composition engine, under determinism (seed ⇒ same data), without mutating canonical schema.

Invariants:
- enum/const selection takes precedence over broad type unions; deterministic by index.
- Strings measured in Unicode code points; regex in Unicode mode.
- With unevaluatedProperties:false or AP:false in any conjunct, generate only evaluated keys (must‑cover intersection).
- Arrays: respect tuple semantics; items:false implies implicit max length; satisfy contains bag with distinct items as needed.
- Numbers: prefer type:'integer' over number+multipleOf:1; use rational helpers for multipleOf.

Algorithm (type‑level):
- String: pick deterministic sample satisfying min/max length and patterns; fallback pattern synthesis when necessary.
- Number/Integer: sample within bounds; snap to multiples; handle exclusive bounds via nudge.
- Array: build prefixItems; fill additional per items constraints; satisfy contains counts; coordinate with uniqueItems (ensure distinctness where needed).
- Object: emit required first then lexical order; only keys recognized by properties|patternProperties|dependentSchemas under AP:false/unevaluated false.

Diagnostics:
- None specific to generator beyond metrics; constraint failures flow to Repair/AJV.

Example:
- Schema with oneOf tagged union and unevaluatedProperties:false ⇒ generator emits only tag + required keys for selected branch; no extras.

Known limits:
- Complex regex may require fallback synthesis that is conservative; final compliance enforced by AJV + Repair.
---
Section 9 — Generator
- Respect enum/const over broad type unions; pick deterministically by index.
- Strings: code-point length, Unicode regex; min/max length; pattern synthesis fallback.
- Formats: annotate-only by default; optional minimal generators for email/uri/uuid/date-time when validateFormats=true.
- Numbers: prefer type 'integer' to number+multipleOf:1; honor bounds and multipleOf using rational helpers.
- Arrays: tuple semantics; implicit max length via items:false; satisfy contains bag with distinct items; coordinate with uniqueItems.
- Objects: stable property order (required first then lexical); with unevaluatedProperties:false, generate only evaluated keys; with AP:false present in any conjunct, enforce must-cover intersection.
tasks.testStrategy: Unit: each type-level generator with corner cases (surrogate pairs, long patterns, rational snapping). Integration: end-to-end generate→validate on mixed schemas.

tasks.title: Repair Engine (AJV-driven)
tasks.description: Implement keyword→actions registry, budgets, stagnation guard, idempotence.
tasks.details:
[Context]
Context need: 5/5
Must read:
- docs/feature-simplification/Invariants.md#ajv-is-the-oracle
- docs/feature-simplification/Features.md#repair
- docs/feature-simplification/Features.md#order-of-operations
Nice to read:
- docs/feature-simplification/error.md#unsat_budget_exhausted
- docs/feature-simplification/Features.md#generator
---
[Normative context]
Scope: Guided by AJV errors on the instance, apply minimal, idempotent changes that monotonically reduce error count, respecting budgets and invariants.

Invariants:
- Idempotence: applying the same repair twice is a no‑op.
- Monotonicity: error count must strictly decrease per pass or stop; enforce stagnation guard.
- No schema mutation; only instance changes.
- Respect uniqueItems via structural hashing; preserve order; if de‑dup removes items needed for contains, re‑satisfy contains needs afterwards.
- For AP:false/unevaluated false, remove extras; never rename required keys from dependents.

Algorithm (order):
1) Shape: satisfy type/required (use defaults or minimal generation for missing props).
2) Bounds: numeric/string/array bounds, including exclusive bounds via ε‑nudges.
3) Semantics: pattern, format (if enabled), multipleOf rational snapping.
4) Sweep: additionalProperties:false / unevaluatedProperties:false cleanup; ensure contains min/max counts (re‑satisfy after uniqueItems if needed).
5) Budgets: track per (instancePath, keyword, normalizedParams); stop on stagnation (UNSAT_BUDGET_EXHAUSTED).

Diagnostics:
- UNSAT_BUDGET_EXHAUSTED (when progress stalls), RAT_* from numeric snapping.

Example:
- Missing required prop under then ⇒ add property with minimal valid value; subsequent AJV pass succeeds.

Known limits:
- Highly tangled oneOf with deep interdependencies may require multiple cycles; budgets limit worst‑case time.
---
Section 10 — Repair
- Mapping: required, type, enum, const, min/max Length, pattern, numeric bounds, exclusive bounds (±ε), multipleOf (rational snap), min/maxItems (respect tuples/items/contains), uniqueItems (struct hash; re‑satisfy contains), AP:false/unevaluated false sweeps, propertyNames safe renames.
- Process order: shape → bounds → semantics → sweep.
- Budgets: per-node attempts (1–3) + seen-set (instancePath, keyword, normalizedParams) to avoid loops.
- Stagnation guard: if over bailOnUnsatAfter cycles error count does not decrease or oscillates, raise UNSAT_BUDGET_EXHAUSTED.
- Logging: return { item, changed, actions[] } where each action records keyword, canonPath, origPath (via ptrMap), and optional details.
tasks.testStrategy: Unit per keyword action (idempotence, error reduction). Integration with generator misfires (intentionally violate then). Metamorphic: repeated repair is no-op.

- Source compiler: strictSchema:false, allowUnionTypes:true, unicodeRegExp:true, useDefaults:false, removeAdditional:false, coerceTypes:false, allErrors:true (for repair), validateFormats: per policy.
- Planning/Generation compiler: strictSchema:true, strictTypes:true, allErrors:false, validateFormats aligned with policy.

tasks.title: Complexity Caps & Graceful Degradation
tasks.description: Detect caps (branches, patterns, enums, contains, schema size) and degrade behavior deterministically.
tasks.details:

tasks.title: Modes: Strict vs Lax Policy
tasks.description: Implement strict/lax behavioral differences, especially for external refs and conditionals strategy.
tasks.details:

---
Section 11 — Modes
- Strict (default): fail early only when impossible or policy forbids; external $ref emits EXTERNAL_REF_UNRESOLVED (configurable error); dynamic refs noted (DYNAMIC_PRESENT).
- Lax: warn for external $ref (EXTERNAL_REF_UNRESOLVED) then attempt local-only generation; final AJV validation may fail when unresolved refs are required.
- With rewriteConditionals:'never': **Strict and Lax both use 'if-aware-lite' by default** (override only via explicit `conditionals.strategy`).
- Budget exhaustion: UNSAT_BUDGET_EXHAUSTED in both modes.
tasks.testStrategy: Matrix tests: Strict vs Lax for external $ref verify EXTERNAL_REF_UNRESOLVED emission and behavior; conditional strategies; ensure consistent diagnostics.

Appendix — Minimal Interfaces
- normalize(schema, opts): returns { schema, ptrMap, revPtrMap, notes } with note codes.
- compose(schema, opts): returns { schema (effective), containsBag?, diag? }.
- compose opts include optional selectorMemoKeyFn(schemaPath, seed, opts) for deterministic score-only memoization.
- repair(item, schema, errors, ctx): returns { item, changed, actions?, diag? } where actions are typed entries { keyword, canonPath, origPath?, details? }.
- AjvErr, RepairCtx, BranchSelector, ContainsNeed types.
- BigInt-safe JSON replacer and rational toJSONSafe.

metadata.description:
Tag 'feature-simplification' — FoundryData Feature Support Simplification Plan.

Guiding philosophy (applies to all tasks):
- 100% Schema Compliance: every generated instance is validated against the original schema by AJV.
- Guaranteed or Transparent: if guarantees cannot be met, emit clear diagnostics explaining why and when support is expected.
- Deterministic: same seed ⇒ same data; no global RNG; bounded attempts.
- Simplicity: pipeline Normalize → Compose → Generate → Repair → Validate; avoid scattered per-feature gates.
- Separation of Concerns: each phase owns a narrow, testable responsibility; canonical schema never mutated by Compose/Generate/Repair.
- Observability: first‑class diagnostics, budgets, and per‑phase metrics (validationsPerRow, repairPassesPerRow, p50/p95 when available).
- Correctness over Features: add complexity only when guarantees hold; use conservative approximations when necessary and document limits.
- Performance: meet SLO/SLI targets with graceful degradation under explicit complexity caps.
- Open Source First: MIT, auditable, contributable, runnable offline.
